articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Milan Pavicic
articles.description: Israel's military campaign in southern Lebanon has caused vast destruction in more than a dozen border towns and villages, reducing many of them to clusters of grey craters, according to satellite imagery provided to Reuters by Planet Labs Inc.
articles.title: Israeli campaign leaves Lebanese border towns in ruins, satellite images show

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks thrust deeper on Monday into two north Gaza towns and a historic refugee camp, trapping around 100,000 civilians, the Palestinian emergency service said, in what the military said were operations to root out regrouping Hamas militants.
articles.title: Palestinians say 100,000 residents trapped in Israel's north Gaza assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte confirmed on Monday that North Korean troops have been sent to Russia and that North Korean military units have been deployed to the Kursk region.
articles.title: NATO chief says he can confirm North Korean troops are in Russia's Kursk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States and the European Union called for a full investigation into reports of violations in an election in Georgia, where the president urged protests on Monday following the disputed parliamentary vote.
articles.title: US, EU call for probe after reports of Georgia election violations

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Tiesha Blackwell, 24, voted for Joe Biden in 2020 but says she is casting her ballot for Republican former President Donald Trump this year, and high food and housing prices are a chief reason.
articles.title: For many US voters, the economy is personal and they blame the Democrats

articles.author: Diego Oré, Laura Gottesdiener, Ted Hesson, Jose Luis Gonzalez
articles.description: At a remote military checkpoint in the Mexican desert some 25 miles (40 km) south of the border city of Ciudad Juarez, immigration agents bundled dozens of migrants onto a bus headed south on a hot night in September.
articles.title: How Mexico’s migrant crackdown influences the U.S. election

articles.author: Christine Kiernan
articles.description: Canada and the U.S. must get tougher on Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government for trying to silence dissidents on foreign soil, a controversial Sikh separatist who was the target of an alleged India-led murder plot said in an interview.
articles.title: Sikh separatist claims Indian 'spy network' operates in US and Canada

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran executed Iranian-German national Jamshid Sharmahd after he was convicted of carrying out terrorist attacks, Iranian state media said on Monday.
articles.title: Iran executes Iranian-German national after terrorism conviction, state media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine would not see any new restrictions on the use of U.S. weapons against North Korean forces should they enter the fight against Ukrainian forces, the Pentagon said on Monday, as it estimated 10,000 North Korean troops had been deployed to eastern Russia for training.
articles.title: No new limits on Ukraine's use of US weapons if N.Korea enters fight, Pentagon says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Monday he hopes to reach peace deals with more Arab countries once the war against Iranian proxies Hamas and Hezbollah is complete.
articles.title: Israel wants more peace deals with Arab countries after war, Netanyahu says
